title: Bip32Ed25519 pure JS implementation
description: Cardano cryptography libraries are available in Rust & Haskell. There is no easy way to build light wallet functionality for web and mobile

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a great project to release a tested and maintained version of an already inhouse implemented version of Bip32Ed25519 in JS. These types of projects obviously widen the net of possible Dev's who can work on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer are already using an in house version and have experience and been funded on projects in this space already. This is a simple proposal to rigorously test, release and maintain this inhouse version. There is no reason to doubt they will be able to successfully deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear plan and deliverables. Whilst there are not really milestones, the final timeline of 15-20 days is relatively short. It would be nice include some metrics for success with attached goals such as number of projects using the library and the number of users those projects have. Basically what impact will delivery of this project have on the Cardano ecosystem. What impact are voters getting for funding this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is refering to lack of certain libraries in JS that would be necessary to create light and fast running wallets and the solution points ti creating a open source library in pure JS as per the requirement for the key BIPED25519 algorithm for which the official provision is there only in RUST and Haskell, so that would suffice to resolve a great deal for JS Developers to serve the purpose there by effectively handeling the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is making a mention of "already worked on this package and a pre-production implementation" that being ready the plan and hence the execution of deliverables should be swiftly achievable considering their testnet deployment for the same.
f6_assessments.q2: There is detailed distribution of Funds mentioned both for releasing and maintaining the deliverable being open source library, also a reasonable timeline for delivery which can be key measures for auditing the progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge is that there is no easy way to build light wallet functionality for web and mobile. The proposal aims to implement an open-source Bip32Edd25519 in JS(TS) based on the research paper published by IOHK.  This proposal adequately addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is experienced and has developed a reference implementation of this package that is being used by the wallet they have launched currently on Testnet. Given the plan presented, this proposal is highly likely to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: Based on the proposal, there are sufficient milestones to audit the progress and ensure success. The main deliverable is the package in 15-20 working days from the approval of the funds.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposer is addressing this challenge by providing a simple JS integration to build light wallet as cryptography libraries are only available in Rust & Huskell so far. The defined solution is based on a research paper published by IOHK. The proposer is able to describe the underlying problem and why his solution will solve this problem. But the proposer does not describe the relevance of this solution and therefore the overall impact on Cardano is a bit vague.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is well-known in the Catalyst project as it is part of the cohort and has already delivered its first proposal (Cardanoscan). Moreover, the applicant has several references for its ability to develop complex solutions for the Cardano blockchain. To better understand the scope of this proposal, I recommend adding more technical details of the solution. The budget is a bit vague, but in my experience, the requested amount is reasonable and fair. Based on the proven track record of this proposer, I expect a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides the community with a clear deliverable and a clear timeline (20 days after funding). A repository is presented, so the community is able to document / observe the progress of this proposal. To improve this proposal I recommend adding some metrics like number of users, etc. so that success is clear defined. Overall, there is sufficient information to audit this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal matches the challenge 100%, because libraries will be the building blocks in the ecosystem and because javascript is one of the more popular programming languages compared to haskel, it's understandable to make libraries on it. Just a small suggestion, a form of metrics on the usage of the library will go a long way in supporting more of your projects in the future!
f6_assessments.q1: Full disclaimer, as a former part of the NativeScript core dev team, i'm a bit bias, I love the proposal. I believe the people behind the proposal are capable of delivering the described library. I didn't see a mention of wheather or not the library would be open source, but because of the link to the public github I assume it will be. I like the formality and concreteness of the proposal and a diverse plan for future development as well. I have been using cardanoscan so I've nothing but positive feedback for the authors. Community adoption fits in great with this proposal. Kudos for the great work!
f6_assessments.q2: Even though progress will be visible in the github repo, a thing that could have been done better is to provide the members of the community with a better execution plan and milestones, instead of "we'll be done in about 1 month", so I'd recommend the proposer focuses on that for future proposals. Separate stages of the library functionality or demos of how to use it would be really helpful for members of the community to track the development progress.

f6_assessments.q0: I think if there is library for Bip32ED25519 cryptography method in JS then it will be great hep for JS developer who wants to contribute in the cardano community building.
f6_assessments.q1: Team has already implemented this package in their new wallet implementation and also launched on testnet recently and this gives a great addition to this idea.
f6_assessments.q2: Idea is presented well and wallet implementation using this package is really good addition to the proposal information.

solution: Implement an open-source Bip32Edd25519 in JS(TS) based on the research paper published by IOHK.
experience: We have developed a reference implementation of this package and is being used by the wallet we have launched currently in testnet.
